info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:38PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Christian and southwestern Sangamon Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 738 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chatham to Divernon to near Auburn. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kincaid, Bulpitt, Jeisyville, Taylorville and Morrisonville. This includes Interstate 55 between mile markers 77 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central Illinois.
